companyDescription:
LeanIX’s Continuous Transformation Platform® offers SaaS solutions to help IT architects, IT asset managers, business leaders, and DevOps teams achieve transparency and control over their enterprise architecture, SaaS, and microservices landscapes.

In a great workplace, employees are more engaged by having information in an understandable context and by feeling confident that decisions are made based on facts.

LeanIX is the single source of truth for Corporate IT and Product IT to create transparency of the present and derive actions, shaping the future in an understandable business context.

We are offering Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) for managing Enterprise Architecture and multi-cloud environments to enable organizations to take faster, data-driven decisions in their IT.
companySlogan: Enabling organizations to continuously transform.
descriptionText:
In less than 12 years, LeanIX has grown from a start-up to a truly global company, already recognized as a market leader in the Enterprise Architecture SaaS sector, and is poised to continue its expansion. To support our growth, we are looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) Developer for our global Finance team.
Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst (f/m/d)Limited contract (12 months) based in Berlin, Bonn, Munich DE or Amsterdam NL
WHAT IS WAITING FOR YOU?Join an experienced BI team and develop and maintain Business Intelligence solutions that meet our evolving business growthOpportunity to innovate new self-serve reporting capabilities on key metrics by leveraging world-class business intelligence productsIt excites you to facilitate ad hoc data-needs for strategic company initiativesLearn from and have frequent high level of interaction with internal (senior) stakeholders to define requirementsFocus on reducing time spent on data mining or validating the integrity of the data by reviewing current solutions, identify issues, defining requirements and implementing the best possible analytical solutionsDevelop or modify data models and ETL processes, and nsure appropriate documentation for all development and modificationA hyper-growth international company already operating in four continentsCompetitive compensation and benefits and a remote first set up, with flexibility to work from everywhere within the country of employment
WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?University degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience3+ years of experience designing and developing solutions with Power BI or TableauHands-on experience with Cloud Data Warehouse (e.g Snowflake, Redshift etc.) and 3+ years of experience designing and developing solutions with Power BI or TableauExperience with SQL, ETL, managing data pipelines, data warehouse design and with pulling data from multiple sourceThrive in a dynamic environment, maintaining composure and a positive attitudeStrong communicator, and fluent (verbal and written) in English language, native German speaker is nice.
LeanIX, The Continuous Transformation Platform® that efficiently organizes, plans and manages IT landscapes, supporting 500+ customers with our 3 solutions Enterprise Architecture Management, SaaS Management Platform and Value Stream Management.LeanIX is not just the product, in fact it‘s a great place to work. Colleagues from dozens of countries jointly make our vision reality. We believe in transparent communication, personal development, diverse workforce, innovation by creating ideas that prove useful and that our world-class team deserves the best software stack money can buy.
At LeanIX we have a Connected Remote Work Mode which means you work remotely from your home office and from our one of our offices (80% of your time). LeanIX teams and team members decide together on the work mode which suits them best.
LeanIX is committed to being an equal opportunity employer. Diversity is vital to driving the growth and success of our company. If you need an equitable interview process alternative, please let our team know at people@leanix.net. You will be treated with the utmost respect and confidentiality.
All applicants will receive consideration for employment based on experience, qualifications, and competencies. LeanIX will not discriminate based on race, color, religion, belief, political affiliation, union membership, age, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, genetic information, creed, citizenship, disability, protected veteran or marital status, or any other status protected by applicable laws or regulations.

When you make the invisible visible, the impossible is possible. Our scientific instruments and solutions help our customers to create a better world. Through chemical, physical and structural analysis of materials, they improve everything from the energies that power us and the materials we build with, to the medicines that cure us and the foods we enjoy. 

We partner with many of the world’s biggest companies, universities and research organizations. They value us not only for the power of our solutions, but also for the depth of our expertise, collaboration and integrity.

descriptionText:
The Marketing Data Analyst leads the development and execution of (new) data elements, fact-based reporting, analysis and analytical models used to enhance decision making across the marketing function and other functions working on the acquisition and retention of customers. The analyst supports the organization with insights using statistical, mathematical/predictive models used to produce results that support strategic objectives. This expert role is part of the Global Demand Centre MT, and provides insights and advice on a frequent basis, at request and on own initiative, to all levels of the organization.

Your Responsibilities

Leads all activities to create, define and implement frameworks for measuring, reporting, analyzing, and benchmarking marketing results to enhance decision making.Develops dashboards and standardized reports to provide ongoing insights and forecasts of KPI’s to marketing, service, and sales stakeholders, provides deep dive analysis and reports to stakeholders, then work to ensure utilization and adoption of reporting by these stakeholders.Create advanced and predictive models such as marketing mix models, MQL & Opportunity scoring, and customer lifetime value, then assist marketing teams in using these models to adjust their tactical mixes.Leads efforts on market research by collecting and analyzing data regarding customer preferences, demographics, buying habits and needs, and competitors, to better identify market trends and potential, factors influencing product and services demand, and improve our general understanding of our customers.Leads efforts to build and maintain the marketing data analytics tech stack, and drives automation and AI into model development.

Your Skills And Knowledge

Bachelor’s degree required, Master’s degree preferred, preferably in a quantitative study like Physics, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, etc.Experience in data analytics, statistical analysis, and modelling/forecasting experience, applied to marketing challenges, is required.Experience in using data management and business intelligence tools, and producing analysis from digital data sources, such as CRM data (preferably Salesforce), Google Analytics, email marketing, and other tracking/performance monitoring tools to inform marketing strategies.Ability to simplify complex problems into understandable reports for marketing leaders and other functions; ability to translate quantitative data into actionable recommendations.English: full professional proficiency.Culturally agile, can effectively lead and build bridges with teams that are geographically and culturally dispersed.Excellent communicator, comfortable being a change agent, educator, and evangelist.Curious, detailed, creative and methodical in problem solving.

This role is based at our Almelo office in the Netherlands or our Malvern office in the UK

Hybrid or remote working possible

Yes, I want this job! 

If you are ready to take on this exciting opportunity, click APPLY NOW to submit your CV and cover letter. Join us at Malvern Panalytical and be part of a team that's big on innovation and making the impossible possible!

When you make the invisible visible, the impossible is possible.

Our analytical systems and services help our customers to create a better world. Through chemical, physical and structural analysis of materials, they improve everything from the energies that power us and the materials we build with, to the medicines that cure us and the foods we enjoy. We partner with many of the world’s biggest companies, universities and research organizations. They value us not only for the power of our solutions, but also for the depth of our expertise, collaboration and integrity.

With over 2200 employees, we serve the world, and we are part of Spectris plc, the world’s leading precision measurements group.

We are Malvern Panalytical. We’re big on small™.

companyDescription:
TBAuctions (TBA) is Europe’s leading online auction platform for B2B used industrial equipment with over 1,000 team members across the Nordics, Benelux +UK, and Continental Europe. We believe that Everything Has Value. With our proprietary intelligent auctioning platform, we make the process of buying and selling more effective and efficient by using technology, artificial intelligence (AI), automation, and economies of scale. TBA’s digital auctions make this happen by creating a cross border platform that offers a perfect match between demand and supply of used business goods. Together with our brands (Auksjonen, British Medical Auctions, DAB, Klaravik, PS Auctions, Troostwijk, and Vavato), TBA brings sustainable trade to a higher level. Sourcing locally and selling globally, millions of products are auctioned every year.

Our vision is to be the first and most trusted choice to buy and sell used business assets, maximizing their lifespan and value; accelerating the circular economy. We are passionate about making digital auctioning the best option to create value for B2B sellers and buyers. We seamlessly connect close, easy, and fast sourcing with global demand by multiplying the power of our people, technology, and data. In doing so, we will build a profitable business, reward and develop our people, and extend the lifecycle of assets to reduce waste and emissions.

We are building a better future, come join us!
companySlogan: Europe's #1 digital auction platform for used B2B goods. Accelerating the circular economy.
descriptionText:
At TBAuctions, we are committed to driving our online auction platform using data. We aim to understand the key drivers, measure our performance, predict future trends, and initiate improvements and innovations based on our insights. To achieve this, you must be an expert in technical analysis and possess the ability to generate enthusiasm for your ideas in a rapidly changing environment.
As a Senior Data Analyst, your analytical mind and passion for data make you the perfect candidate to proactively provide the business with relevant and actionable insights. You will achieve this by collecting, analyzing, and interpreting the right data and translating it into meaningful conclusions.
This is what you will do:Collaborate with various teams in strategy, operations, finance, and technology, providing them with insights to better understand and explain their business.Build and manage KPI dashboards that other teams rely on for decision-making.Contribute to operational and strategic platform issues, supporting your insights with tailored data analytics.Communicate your findings to the rest of the company and drive change in the product and our proposition. Insights are valuable, but the impact is even better!
What you will bring5+ years of Analytics or Business Intelligence experience.Ability to identify product and business opportunities through data and clearly communicate them to colleagues.Skilled at transforming raw data into a wealth of opportunities.Expertise in SQL, including the use of window functions, UDFs, self-joins, and other complex SQL functionalities.Expertise in DatabricksKnowledge and experience with a visualization tool (ideally Power BI) and setting up an environment for colleagues to view their dashboards.Proficient at translating business questions into analytical questions and sharing insights with colleagues.Ability to empathize with the product and address the underlying questions.Experience in balancing speed and accuracy and managing stakeholders in this area.
Bonus Points:Affinity with e-commerce.Familiarity with at least one scripting language (ideally Python) Experience with the DBT and tabular modelingInterest in contributing to data pipelines that transform unstructured raw data into tables ready for analysis
What we offer you 🥳Independent and varied role within an entrepreneurial and innovative organizationSalary of 55.000,- - 70.000,-Good pension schemeBonus scheme (up to 1 gross monthly salary per year)25 vacation daysLaptop and iPhoneTraining opportunitiesWorking in a team of professionals, where hard work is well combined with humor ✨
This is TBAuctionsNothing of value should be lost
In a world where overconsumption is a threat, TBAuctions finds it important to extend the life of products as long as possible. So, nothing of value should be lost. Our online intelligent auction platform makes this happen. By using data and a smart system we match supply and demand of used industrial products. Together with our auction brands (Troostwijk Auctions, Klaravik, Auksjonen, British Medical Auctions, PS Auction, Vavato and Epic-Auctions) we bring sustainable trade to a higher level. With buyers and sellers all over the world millions of products are auctioned every year.
Auctioning is trendy and the way to buy and sell. We are fascinated by technology, with a love for user-friendliness and the drive to preserve value. Do you share this drive and do you want to work for a company that has the ambition and the firepower to become the largest online auction platform in Europe? Apply for this vacancy!

companyDescription:
The Rainforest Alliance is an international non-profit organization working in more than 60 countries at the intersection of business, agriculture, and forests. We are building an alliance to create a better future for people and nature by making responsible business the new normal.

By bringing diverse allies together we are making deep-rooted change on some of our most pressing social and environmental issues. Together, we amplify the voices of farmers and forest communities, improve livelihoods, protect biodiversity, and help people mitigate and adapt to climate change in bold and effective ways. 

Join our alliance.

Our alliance is all about changing the way the world produces, sources and consumes. Every company has the power to help build a better future by sourcing commodities responsibly and adapting its business model to become more sustainable. 

By joining us, you are helping meet the increase in demand for responsibly made products. And when the demand is there, farmers and foresters work hard to meet it, helping drive real, meaningful impact. Everyone wins when we bring the right people together.

The Rainforest Alliance has recently merged with UTZ, a Netherlands-based program and label for sustainable farming worldwide. More information about the UTZ certification program here: https://www.rainforest-alliance.org/utz/.

Want to explore our career opportunities? 👉 https://www.rainforest-alliance.org/careers/
companySlogan: An international non-profit organization working to create a better future for people and nature
descriptionText:
Position summary: At the Rainforest Alliance, we believe in the value of data. The Data Management and Intelligence department is paving the way for enabling data-based decisions by focusing on the delivery of scale-able data products to the market, supporting internal decision-making by unlocking the value of data, and creating a solid data foundation on which we can continue to build out our data offering.
The Data Analyst, Data Products reporting into the Data Products, Analytics Manager will develop data-as-a-product solutions to the market. The data analyst proactively reaches out to stakeholders to understand their data and reporting needs and translates those into data products which enable decision-making. They are responsible for ensuring that the data products released are fit for purpose and deliver optimal value. With a vast array of partners across the global supply chains that we work in, it is essential that data products are designed and positioned according to our multitude of partner needs from producers to market partners.
They will have a comprehensive understanding of our systems and the data available. Get involved at the beginning of initiatives to ensure that data requirements are clear and later work with the technology organization regarding how that data flows through our systems and warehouse. The Data Analyst will be able to translate these complex datasets into user-friendly (standardized) reporting for users that delivers actionable insights. They will be a subject matter expert on both Power BI and supply chain reporting capabilities within the Data Products team (within the larger Data Management & Intelligence department) and serve as the point of contact on established reports. They will actively engage with cross-departmental and external stakeholders to ensure that they are enabled to use established reporting independently and promote knowledge of reporting capabilities across all stakeholders.
Responsibilities: Proactively connect and engage with Corporate Engagement & Partnership account managers to ensure that data is compiled and summarized in ways that aid management decision making as well as client needs;Work collaboratively across departments to drive insights externally based on data (i.e. translating data to action);Ensure that data requirements are considered in the beginning of strategic initiatives so that data collection and structure will be fit for purpose in supporting the data-as-a-product approach;Maintain regular alignment with your colleagues in the DM&I department to ensure common approaches to data metrics, that data quality practices are implemented in your products, and that sharing of those products is done in an ethical way;Leads training initiatives to enable internal stakeholders to not only use the reporting available, but also deliver insights to their customers (will be phased out as this capability is centralized into a role);Leads external training initiatives as part of customer roll out (will be phased out as this capability is centralized into a role);Continuously improve reporting capabilities by sharing best practices within the DM&I department;Responsible for rolling out dashboards to the organization and supporting project-related rollouts. Driving alignment with internal stakeholders as part of the customer roll out process;Understand the external reporting needs from the different stakeholders via current report feedback, external reporting offering, and overall reporting trends in CSR, ESG, and SDG that align with RA’s mission. Advise on direction of travel for reporting as a result;Identify potential biases and reporting risks by periodically connecting with colleagues in the field/ stakeholders involved in the data gathering and provide them with reports that allow them to identify and prevent these risks and biases;Establish a standardized and organized way of gathering regional insight and integrate it as data in our internal reports to promote bottom-top strategies, and;Identifying opportunities to integrate data in an efficient, intuitive way to maximize engagement and ease of use. Delivery:
Responsible for transforming requests from Corporate Engagement & Partnerships and other RA staff into meaningful reports and insights – including self service capabilities for stakeholder groups;Lead the deployment and ongoing improvement of self-service capabilities to stakeholder groups;Champion automation by finding solutions that are fit for purpose and scalable to suit the major requirements of stakeholders;Serve as a Power BI expert within the organization; andAd hoc reporting as needed (as agreed in prioritization with the Analytics Manager) Qualifications: 
Master’s degree, with fluency in mathematics, statistics and/or data analysis strongly preferred;3-5 years’ experience data reporting and analysis;3-5 years’ experience with supply chain traceability preferred;Practical experience using Rainforest Alliance supply chain and traceability systems preferred;E2E experience with data visualization tools like Power BI, tableau, etc; andExcel expert. 
Deadline: 15 March 2024
Notes: Only candidates authorized to work in Kenya, the Netherlands or the UK will be considered.
If you have any questions about the job vacancy, please contact the HR department: recruitment@ra.org

WHO WE ARE: The Rainforest Alliance is creating a more sustainable world by using social and market forces to protect nature and improve the lives of farmers and forest communities. To achieve our mission, we partner with diverse allies around the world to drive positive change across global supply chains and in many of our most critically important natural landscapes.
Our alliance spans 70 countries and includes farmers and forest communities, companies, governments, civil society, and millions of individuals. Together we work to protect forests and biodiversity, take action on climate, and promote the rights and improve the livelihoods of rural people.
As an international nonprofit organization with more than 30 years of experience in sustainability transformation, we understand that the social and economic well-being of rural communities is tightly connected to ecosystem health. This knowledge has shaped our rigorous programs to advance sustainable land-use and commodity production.
At the Rainforest Alliance we combat climate change, protect forests and biodiversity, promote human rights, and improve livelihoods. The enormity of the social and environmental challenges we are facing requires working together in a broad alliance. This is why we bring farmers, forest communities, companies, and consumers together to change the way the world produces, sources, and consumes.
Why To protect nature and improve lives it’s becoming increasingly urgent that we approach the way we use our land and produce food and other products in more sustainable ways. For this to succeed we need to fundamentally change the way that businesses operate and source, and the choices we all make as consumers.
How Our growing global alliance aims to transform our relationship with our natural resources and each other, to create a better future for people and nature together.
The Rainforest Alliance encourages diversity and inclusion across the global organization. With this commitment to diversity, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of gender, race, color, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, ages, disability, and any other protected group.

companyDescription:
Jack Link's Protein Snacks is a global leader in snacking and the No. 1 meat snack manufacturer worldwide. 

Still family-owned with headquarters in Minong (Wisconsin), US,  Jack Link’s also has a EMEA headoffice in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. 

Jack Link’s produces high-quality, great-tasting protein snacks that feed the wild sides of consumers around the world. Jack Link's Protein Snacks family of brands includes Jack Link's, BiFi, Peperami, and Minuets.

The story of Jack Link’s is one of family traditions. It began with treasured family recipes passed from generation to generation, transforming a small regional business into one of the fastest-growing snack manufacturers in the world. Today Jack Link’s sells more than 100 different protein snacks in more than 40 countries. 

In 2014 Jack Link's acquired the BiFi and Peperami brands from Unilever, as well as a plant in Ansbach, Germany. As per the end of 2014, the brand new EMEA headoffice in Amsterdam was operational as well. The EMEA team currently consist of about 500 employees. About 430 employees work in the Ansbach factory where BiFi and Peperami are produced. The others are working in  Amsterdam and in the Sales teams in the markets. These employees are currently further developing their own, new Jack Link’s EMEA culture, adopting the global Jack Link’s values. Being real, showing character and stewardship are key words, just as words like entrepreneurship, accountability and constructive conflict.

See all job openings at https://jack-links.onlinevacatures.nl/en
companySlogan: Feed your wild side!
descriptionText:
Make a difference in the world of branded protein snacking as Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (1 fte) at Jack Link’s EMEA.
AboutOur family owned and value driven business is dedicated to crafting protein-packed snacks that are loved by consumers worldwide. Our array of brands include some of the fastest growing and innovating protein snack brands such as Jack Link's, BiFi and Peperami.Our spacious and modern Jack Link’s EMEA headquarters is located in the vibrant Amsterdam Houthavens, and includes a highly international team, with more than 25 different nationalities. Our EMEA team is committed to continuing its impressive EMEA expansion, one bite at a time, and becoming the regional leader in branded protein snacks.Job Description
PositionOur Senior Business Intelligence Analyst is constantly looking for ways to provide actionable business insights to improve a business process and enable business decisions in a user-friendly way.You are constantly engaged with business teams and leaders and listen carefully to business challenges to offer ideas and possible solutions that are relevant in today’s marketplace. You are involved in providing insights from concept to delivery, while managing and prioritizing the product delivery backlog. You possess good understanding of SAP capabilities, domain knowledge/expertise and are capable of translating business requirements into visual insights and reports.
ResponsibilitiesDevelop long term Roadmap for Business Visual Insights across organizational functions.Collaborate with the business management team to identify top priority BI deliverables that generate revenue, improve the bottom line, eliminate complexity, or drastically improve business processesCollaborate with the business and IT teams to deliver fully functional BI deliverables that are actionable and meet business needsAlign and lead with the functional and IT teams to create integration channels for data collection to be used to report generationSubject matter expert who understands the business needs and translates them into user stories (or Specs) and backlog itemsEnsure each story or backlog item has the correct acceptance criteriaBe available to attend daily stand-ups as needed and work with development teams so that clear understanding of backlog items is achieved by providing guidance and clarification when sought. When needed, participate in direct development activitiesEstablish strong, open, and real business team leader relationships and represent the customer/business teams on development effortsParticipate in team activities and team planning regarding improving team skills, awareness, and quality of workDevelop quality code and its associated documentation adhering to team and departmental development standardsTroubleshooting and resolution of issuesKeep abreast of industry BI trends and capabilitiesPerforms other duties and responsibilities as necessary
QualificationsRequired Education: BA/BS in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Sciences, Finance, or equivalent job experienceRequired Experience:7+ years of recent experience in Business Intelligence and Data Warehousing5+ years of experience in Production Planning and/or Supply Chain Analytics5+ years delivering Insights, Dashboards, Visualizations/Reports to business teams using tools like Microsoft Power BI & SAP Webi3+ years of Agile developmentPreferred:Analytics experience with Finance, Sales, Marketing, Sales Planning and PromotionsUnderstanding of and experience with SAP ECC, BW on Hana, Hana Modeling, SAP Hana Modeling tools, S4 HanaUnderstanding and experience with AI, ML, Data Sciences, unstructured data
Skills and competenciesAbility to conceptualize, analyze issue and deliver solutionsAbility to work autonomously, prioritize and meet deadlines within specified time constraintsExcellent verbal and written communications skills and must work effectively with all levels of management and employeesMust demonstrate effective leadership, problem solving, presentation, and employee motivational skillsIdentify and define business questions and associated data needsPartner with the business team to create actionable Business Intelligence deliverables and insights leveraging an iterative approachTeam player with a “can do” attitudeAbility to adapt in a changing work environmentQuick learnerAbility to work with an iterative and incremental development environmentFamiliar with multiple Agile development methodologies, has been part of an agile team and is comfortable leading an agile team
Working at Jack Link’s EMEA means working in a fun, fast-growing international company with great ambitions.
By joining us, you willHave the chance to build a career as your unique self with all the support we can give you to become the best version of yourselfWork in an open, transparent, and inclusive culture with colleagues from all over the worldReceive a salary at market level that fits your experienceExperience a fast paced and dynamic work atmosphereReceive 27 vacation days, a good company pension plan and an annual bonusBoost your health with a ClassPass subscription and nutritious food offered by the companyAttend our fun and engaging events
If this sounds like a role that is suited to your skill set, why not apply today!
recruiter/headline: Talent Acquisition Specialist Jack Link's EMEA

companyDescription:
Based in Den Bosch, The Netherlands, My Jewellery is a jewellery and fashion brand with attention for everyone. Driven by our ambition we embarked on this journey in the summer of 2011, and to this day a touch of summer is part of the My Jewellery DNA all year round.  

We offer affordable Dutch design, including jewellery, clothing, beauty and lifestyle products, that is accessible and wearable for everyone. Our motto ‘what are we celebrating today?’ is one we truly live by, as we seek to make things more fun for everyone, now and in the future. We are embracing our responsibility for a better tomorrow, because we want future generations to have something to celebrate too, and we truly believe that by viewing the future with optimism, attention and power, we can tackle any challenge that comes our way. 

Over the years the development of our signature My Jewellery brand has taught us many lessons, all of which have made us even more ambitious than ever before, and that shows in the more than 600 employees, spread across our HQ, our warehouse and in 26 boutiques across the Netherlands, Belgium & Germany, who work passionately for My Jewellery. Ultimately, we all have one goal: innovating My Jewellery as a brand and a business!

For more information about our ongoing adventure:
Please visit my-jewellery.com or instagram@myjewellery
companySlogan: Based in Den Bosch, The Netherlands, My Jewellery is a jewellery and fashion brand with attention for everyone.
descriptionText:
Als Junior Data Analist bij My Jewellery werk jij dagelijks aan het verwerken en analyseren van data. Aan jou de taak om de business continu te helpen meer data gedreven keuzes te maken. In jouw rol als Data Analist analyseer en controleer jij de data. Daarnaast zorg je ervoor dat de business door middel van dashboards dagelijks de resultaten kan gebruiken om data-gedreven beslissingen te nemen.
Jouw analyses en oplossingen helpen anderen binnen My Jewellery beter te presteren en bieden strategische inzichten om de juiste keuzes te maken. De gegevens die je verwerkt komen onder andere uit onze e-commerce-, ERP en marketing automationsystemen, maar ook van externe bronnen zoals social media kanalen. Binnen My Jewellery ben je één van de eerste aanspreekpunten bij vragen over data en dashboards. Dit ga je natuurlijk niet alleen doen, je komt te werken binnen het Business Intelligence team van My Jewellery. Een jong en gedreven team waar innovatie voorop staat dat bestaat, uit Data Analytics Engineers, BI Specialisten en Data Analisten.
Je komt te werken in een jonge en snelgroeiende organisatie waar heel veel behoefte is aan data en inzichten. Voorbeelden van analyses en dashboards zijn verkoop-analyses op product en klant niveau, voorraad-analyses, social media performance dashboards, management dashboards, etc.
TakenJij bouwt met behulp van de BI specialisten datamodellen;Jij stelt dashboards en analyses op en ziet toe op het juiste gebruik hiervan;Jij brengt advies uit aan de relevante stakeholders op basis van je analyses;Jij analyseert vragen uit de business, maar initieert ook je eigen data-analyses om de organisatie verder te brengen;Jij denkt samen met het team mee hoe we de data zo efficient en betrouwbaar mogelijk kunnen leveren aan de stakeholders.
VereistenEen afgeronde relevante HBO- of WO-opleiding (bijvoorbeeld data science, business analytics, informatica);Zelfstandig, nieuwsgierig en analytisch;Jij bent communicatief sterk en schakelt makkelijk tussen business en data;Jij bent bereid SQL te leren (Ervaring met SQL is een pré).
Wij biedenBijdragen aan de groei & ontwikkeling van een van de meest ambitieuze (mode)brands/organisaties van Nederland, in een zelfstandig team met betrokken & daadkrachtige collega’s en waar jouw frisse input & ervaring enorm wordt gewaardeerd;Een dynamische werkomgeving waar vooruitgang, innovatie en ontwikkeling wekelijks centraal staat en waarbij er voor jou altijd ruimte is om impact te maken;Vanzelfsprekend een mooi marktconform salaris en een goede pensioenregeling;Wanneer nodig een laptop & telefoon;Aandacht voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling en (groei) ambities gefaciliteerd door onze interne Learning & Development afdeling;De mogelijkheid om hybride te werken (wij werken minimaal drie dagen per week op kantoor). Daarnaast zijn er mogelijkheden voor thuiswerken & workation;Een aantrekkelijke personeelskorting van maar liefst 45% op de My Jewellery collectie;Samen sporten onder begeleiding van een personal trainer op maandag & woensdag;Een inspirerende werkomgeving, het My Jewellery hoofdkantoor in ‘s-Hertogenbosch (wat goed bereikbaar is met het OV en de auto) met een gezellige bistro, iedere dag gratis vers fruit & natuurlijk lekkere koffie!Wij werken onder het motto “What are we celebrating today?”. We vieren grote & kleine successen samen door middel van teamuitjes en feestjes.
Over My JewelleryVandaag de dag is My Jewellery met een ambitieus, toegewijd en gedreven team een van de snelst groeiende e-commerce bedrijven van Nederland. Elke dag werken wij met meer dan 650 medewerkers, vol aandacht & power bij My Jewellery, om een merk te creëren dat het beste van ons allemaal vertegenwoordigt. Met oog voor elkaar, klanten, leveranciers & omgeving, blijven wij stappen zetten naar verdere groei in binnen- en buitenland.
Interesse?Als je interesse hebt in deze functie, solliciteer dan direct via onderstaande button! Heb je vragen over deze vacature? Stuur dan een mail met jouw vraag naar Nikki via nikki.vanderpol@my-jewellery.com.
recruiter/headline: Corporate recruiter @ My Jewellery
title: Junior Data Analist

companyDescription:
We are an independent consultancy firm which integrates 140 years of engineering expertise with digital technologies and software solutions.

As consulting engineers, we care deeply about our people, our clients and society at large. Through our mission Enhancing Society Together, we take responsibility for having a positive impact on the world. We constantly challenge ourselves and others to develop sustainable solutions to local and global issues related to the built environment.
companySlogan: Enhancing Society Together
descriptionText:
De wereld van asset management transformeert. Nieuwe uitdagingen, scherpere behoeftes en hogere verwachtingen van stakeholders maken dat we de wereld van asset management opnieuw moeten uitvinden. Eén van de belangrijkste ontwikkelingen hierin is het gebruik van data en de inzet van nieuwe en moderne technologie. De omslag van onze klanten naar een digitaal en datagedreven manier van asset management is echter niet zo eenvoudig gemaakt.

Voor ons groeiende team in het asset management domein zoeken we een Business Intelligence Consultant die bij onze klanten datagedreven asset management gaat vormgeven. Maak jij met jouw IT- en data-expertise het verschil?

Wat je doet als Business Intelligence Consultant

Als BI Consultant ben je de drijvende kracht achter innovatieve en digitale oplossingen voor onze klanten. Vanuit je natuurlijke nieuwsgierigheid duik je in de business en de processen van onze klanten, op zoek naar optimalisatiemogelijkheden. Dit betekent dat je je onder andere bezig houdt met:

Het vertalen van klantvragen naar digitale producten en diensten. Hierbij vorm je de brug tussen de klant, IT en techniek. Natuurlijk samen met je collega’s.Het bouwen aan een datalandschap waarmee we kunnen rapporteren over de KPI’s die we samen met onze klanten zijn overeengekomen.Het bouwen van oplossingen die aansluiten op de wensen van de klant. Variërend van het adviseren van de klant over toekomstige innovaties, automatiseren van processen tot het ontwikkelen van (PowerBI) dashboards.Het bijdragen aan trainingen die de kennisontwikkeling over data stimuleren.

Daarnaast draag je ook bij aan de ontwikkeling van ons groeiende team, waarbij je een belangrijke rol speelt in digitale innovaties. Je geeft daarbij invulling aan de digitale roadmap van de afdeling waarin alle projecten rondom digitalisering samenkomen.

Waar je komt te werken

Royal HaskoningDHV is een onafhankelijk bureau dat 140 jaar advies- en ingenieurskennis integreert met digitale technologie en software-oplossingen. Onze ruim 6.000 collega’s werken, verspreid over kantoren in meer dan 20 landen, samen met klanten aan toekomstbestendige oplossingen voor een betere leefomgeving en de transitie naar een slimme, duurzame organisatie. Met onze ambitie willen we samen met onze opdrachtgevers een positieve bijdrage leveren aan de volgende generaties. Duurzaamheid neemt daarin een centrale plek in. Wij zijn een divers bedrijf: van slimme ingenieurs, tot vaardige projectmanagers en bedreven consultants die goed zijn in het bedenken en ontwerpen van intelligente steden, luchthavens, havens, infrastructuur, gebouwen en nog veel meer. In een steeds sneller tempo verbinden we de beste en slimste mensen ter wereld en ondersteunen zo onze klanten met een betere en snellere uitvoering van hun duurzame ambities. Dat noemen we: ‘Enhancing Society Together’.

Je komt te werken binnen de adviesgroep Asset Management. Deze bestaat uit zo’n 180 collega’s verspreid over verschillende kantoren in Nederland zoals Amersfoort, Amsterdam, Eindhoven en Maastricht. Welk kantoor jouw standplaats wordt, dat bepalen we samen, onder andere op basis van je woonplaats. En omdat samenwerken ook gebaat gaat bij fysiek samen zijn, ontmoeten we elkaar regelmatig op een van deze locaties.

Vanuit de adviesgroep werken wij voor verschillende (grote) klanten in onder andere de energie, bancaire, logistieke en industriële sector. Onze opdrachtgevers willen allemaal hun Asset Management organisatie transformeren. Denk hierbij aan civiele infrastructuur, gebouwen en gebouw gerelateerde installaties. Het integreren van het digitale component wordt daarin steeds belangrijker.

Je wordt binnen de adviesgroep onderdeel van het team Data & Digital. Dit team heeft als doel om digitaal en datagedreven asset management verder te ontwikkelen en uit te bouwen.

Wat je met ons gemeen hebt

In ons groeiende team omarmen we diversiteit en authenticiteit. Dit betekent dat we benieuwd zijn naar jouw verhaal, ontwikkeling en achtergrond. En hierbij kijken we verder dan alleen je diploma. Wat ons samenbrengt is enthousiasme, toewijding en eigen persoonlijkheid met hart voor een duurzame toekomst. Daarin maken samenwerkingsgerichtheid en het nemen van initiatief ons succesvol.

We vinden het belangrijk dat je bij ons goed op je plek zit en dat je jezelf kunt ontwikkelen op zowel persoonlijk als professioneel vlak. Herken je je in bovenstaande karaktereigenschappen en in de onderstaande punten? Dan zouden we een hele goede match kunnen zijn. 

Je hebt een afgeronde hbo-/wo-opleiding in IT, data of soortgelijke richtingJe hebt kennis van het Power Platform (PowerBI, PowerApps, PowerAutomate)Je hebt ervaring in/kennis van de volgende zaken:Data visualisatie, data analyse en data modelleringData ScienceSQL/NoSQLAgileJe hebt analytische vaardigheden waarmee je relaties en verbanden legtJe bent communicatief en sociaal vaardig.Je hebt goede presentatie vaardigheden en bent in staat tot het effectief faciliteren van workshops

Aangezien onze klantenkring hoofdzakelijk Nederlands georiënteerd is en we weten hoe belangrijk dat gesprek bij het koffiezetapparaat is, vragen we vaardigheid van de Nederlandse taal op minimaal B2 niveau en de bereidheid om dit te blijven ontwikkelen.

Voldoe je niet aan alle bovenstaande punten, maar word je enthousiast van de rol? Dan nodigen we je van harte uit om toch te solliciteren. Wij geloven namelijk dat je dingen eigen kunt maken. Jouw verhaal is daarom ook meer dan het afvinken van de bovenstaande punten.

Dit krijg je van ons

Naast dat je je bij ons kunt ontwikkelen binnen de mooiste en uitdagendste projecten, bieden we je ook:

Een salaris tussen de €2905 en €5606 per maand, gebaseerd op jouw ervaring.Een goede balans tussen werk en privé, onder andere door een laptop en telefoon van de zaak zodat je kunt werken waar en wanneer je wil;28 vakantiedagen bij een fulltime dienstverband;Persoonlijk budget boven op je salaris dat je kunt gebruiken om bijvoorbeeld extra vakantiedagen te kopen. Je kunt dit ook laten uitbetalen;Een uitstekende pensioenopbouw via ons eigen pensioenfonds;Een goed bereikbare werkplek op een van onze kantoren én reiskostenvergoeding of een NS-Business Card;Volop opleidings- en ontwikkelmogelijkheden; we hebben voldoende aandacht voor jou en begeleiden je actief in je ontwikkeling;Ons uitdagende Young Professional Program waarin je je, samen met andere young professional binnen de organisatie, focust op het snel ontwikkelen van je hard en soft skills;Young Royal HaskoningDHV dat leuke events, workshops en excursies organiseert met collega’s binnen en buiten Nederland.


Ben jij onze nieuwe collega?

We maken graag kennis met je! Klik op de solliciteer button onder aan de pagina en upload je cv en motivatiebrief t.a.v. Joppe Ter Meer, Manager Data & Digital Asset Management. Heb je nog vragen? Neem dan contact op met Kevin Zandbergen, Recruiter Industry & Buildings, via kevin.zandbergen@rhdhv.com .
title: Business Intelligence Consultant

companyDescription:
Dormio Group is een dynamische en innovatieve organisatie met ruim 20 jaar ervaring in de leisure branche. Al vanaf de oprichting in 2001 ontwikkelt Dormio luxe vakantieresorts en hotels op toeristische toplocaties. Inmiddels zijn wij uitgegroeid tot een succesvolle en een unieke speler in de leisure branche. Als full-service partner zijn we verantwoordelijk voor de ontwikkeling, verkoop, verhuur, beheer en exploitatie van alle resorts, vakantieparken en hotels. Met resorts, vakantieparken en hotels in Nederland, Duitsland, Frankrijk, Oostenrijk en Spanje bieden wij voor zowel investeerders als onze vakantiegasten een divers en uitgebreid aanbod aan vakantiewoningen en -appartementen geschikt voor 2 tot en met 20 personen.

De naam Dormio staat voor onbezorgd genieten. Dat is onze filosofie. Of het nu gaat om projectontwikkeling, verkoop of verhuur en beheer van onze resorts en hotels; het is onze missie om zowel huurders als eigenaren maximaal te ontzorgen zodat iedereen onbezorgd van zijn of haar vakantiewoning kan genieten. Dat doen we door onze marktkennis, betrokkenheid en liefde voor het leisure-vak in te zetten om gasten en eigenaren een optimale vakantiebeleving te bezorgen.

Dormio bestaat uit 3 bedrijfstakken:
- Ontwikkeling van resorts en hotels: Dormio Leisure Development
- Verkoop van recreatief vastgoed: Dormio Investments
- Verhuur, beheer en exploitatie van resorts, vakantieparken en hotels: Dormio Resorts & Hotels en Summio Parcs
descriptionText:
Als onderdeel van ons groeiende Digital Marketingteam, zoeken we een Online Data Analist die ons helpt onze ambitie waar te maken!
Wat ga je doen?In deze veelzijdige en interessante rol op het snijvlak van web analytics, digital marketing en business intelligence, krijg je de kans om onze merken Dormio en Summio nóg succesvoller te maken. Als Online Data Analist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het analyseren van grote hoeveelheden online data. Je zet deze data om in waardevolle inzichten en identificeert kansen voor verbetering van onze online marketingactiviteiten.
Door het creëren van overzichtelijke rapportages en dashboards, monitor je de prestaties van verschillende marketingkanalen en -campagnes. Je werkt nauw samen met het Digital Marketingteam om A/B-tests en andere experimenten op te zetten en te evalueren, met als doel de effectiviteit van onze online strategie te optimaliseren.
Als expert in het identificeren van trends en patronen in data, ontdek je nieuwe kansen en strategieën die ons kunnen helpen om nóg succesvoller te worden. Je deelt deze bevindingen met het managementteam en levert waardevolle input voor het nemen van beslissingen wat betreft de marketingstrategie.
Waar kom je te werken?Je komt te werken op het hoofdkantoor van Dormio in Arnhem, op de afdeling Verhuur, in een ambitieus team. Bij Dormio heerst een test & learn mentaliteit. We moedigen innovatie en creativiteit aan, en jouw ideeën zijn meer dan welkom.
Bij Dormio krijg je de unieke kans om deel uit te maken van een bruisend, snelgroeiend bedrijf met een dynamische én internationale werkomgeving. Hier kun je jouw vaardigheden en ervaringen op het gebied van Online Data naar een hoger niveau tillen.
Bekijk gerust onze website voor nog meer informatie over onze snelgroeiende organisatie!Wat heb jij Dormio te bieden?
Om succesvol te zijn in deze rol, heb je een afgeronde bacheloropleiding in een relevante richting en een aantal jaar ervaring als Data Analist, bij voorkeur in een digitale marketingomgeving. Je bent bekend met web analytics tools zoals Google Analystics en hebt ervaring met het analyseren van grote datasets. Verder beschik je over:
Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden;Het vermogen om complexe analyses te vertalen naar begrijpelijke presentaties;Een resultaatgerichte mindset en de capaciteit om onder druk te werken en strakke deadlines te halen;Een uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal, dit is bij Dormio ook de voertaal;
Wat heeft Dormio jou te bieden?Bij ons kom je te werken in een informele sfeer waar we ontwikkeling hoog in het vaandel hebben. Naast vakantiegeld (8%) hebben we primaire en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden die interessant voor je kunnen zijn. Zo bieden we een goede pensioensregeling, een aantrekkelijke personeelskorting voor een verblijf op onze resorts en hotels én luiden we elke vrijdag het weekend in met onze borrels in ons eigen café 'In de Proeftijd'.
Verder bieden wij je:
Een baan voor 36-40 uur per week;Een salarisrange tussen de € 2.500 en € 3.200 per maand (o.b.v. 40 uur);Een toffe werkplek in ons kantoor in het centrum van Arnhem;Startdatum: wat ons betreft zo snel mogelijk! Natuurlijk houden wij rekening met jouw opzegtermijn;De mogelijkheid om gebruik te maken van onze collectieve ziektekostenverzekering;Een gunstige personeelsboekingsregeling.
SolliciterenHerken jij jezelf in deze vacature? Dan willen wij jou graag ontmoeten! Stuur ons jouw CV en motivatiebrief via de 'Solliciteer nu' button op onze website. We nemen zo snel mogelijk contact met je op.
Acquisitie wordt niet op prijs gesteld.
title: Online Data Analist

companyDescription:
The Kraft Heinz Company is one of the largest food and beverage companies in the world, with eight $1 billion+ brands and global sales of approximately $25 billion. We’re a globally trusted producer of high-quality, great-tasting, and nutritious foods for over 150 years. While Kraft Heinz is co-headquartered in Chicago and Pittsburgh, our brands are truly global, with products produced and marketed in over 40 countries. These beloved products include condiments and sauces, cheese and dairy, meals, meats, refreshment beverages, coffee, infant and nutrition products, and numerous other grocery products in a portfolio of more than 200 legacy and emerging brands.

We spark joy around mealtime with our iconic brands, including Kraft, Oscar Mayer, Heinz, Philadelphia, Lunchables, Velveeta, Maxwell House, Capri Sun, Ore-Ida, Kool-Aid, Jell-O, Primal Kitchen, and Classico, among others. 

No matter the brand, we’re united under one vision: To sustainably grow by delighting more consumers globally. Bringing this vision to life is our team of 37,000+ food lovers, creative thinkers, and high performers worldwide. Together, we help provide meals to those in need through our global partnership with Rise Against Hunger. We also stand committed to responsible, sustainable practices that extend to every facet of our business, our consumers, and our communities. Every day, we’re transforming the food industry with bold thinking and unprecedented results. If you share our passion – and are ready to create the future, build a legacy, and lead as a global citizen – there’s only one thing to do: join our table and let’s make life delicious!
companySlogan: Let's make life delicious!
descriptionText:
General information 

 All posting locations  Amsterdam, , Netherlands

 Job Function  10 - R&D

 Date Published  07-Nov-2023

 Ref #  R-76449

 Description & Requirements 

 Start date  March

 Duration 5 to 6 months

 Platform/Project  R&D Digital Transformation

 Location  Amsterdam

You will be part of an international small team with the ambition to drive digital technology forward for Kraft Heinz R&D International Zone. Expect to be part of the team from day one. Strong learning experience on data visualization with many practical deliverables which will be used directly by the organization.

Assignments and key activities

Support dashboard creation to support day to day work of R&D functions Support digital transformation across the R&D team (e.g. communication about changes- identification of digital tools required by R&D team) Investigate new tools and trends in Digital world Participate & contribute into meetings related to Digital strategy Collaboration with Digital Ambassadors 


Requirements

Having a Business Analytics/Management/Information Technology backgroundData visualization skills (Tableau, Power BI)Being comfortable with working with big dataHaving a structured personality with ability to learn fastPrevious internship with data visualization or experience with data analytics is a plus You should have strong communication skills and fluency in English, both written and verbal (Dutch is not a requirement but other languages are a plus)  You are enrolled at a university for at least 50% study load for the duration of the internship.  NOTE EU working rights are required (Either you have EU Citizenship, you are studying in the Netherlands or have relevant student work visa) 


Recruitment process 

 CV selection based on hard requirements such as EU working rights Online Pymetrics assessment Online Pymetrics video assessment Online Screening Interview via Microsoft Teams Hiring manager interview Amazing internship opportunity that can kickstart your career!


Note The recruitment process can take 4/6 weeks in total

What We Offer You

We take interns seriously. You can expect from us to give you 1-on-1 mentorship from one of our experienced colleagues. We will work together on your personal learning goals and are keen to hear all good ideas you have! We will give you the space and support to make mistakes and grow. Become a part of a close intern community as well as a young and ambitious work environment (including online).

As a Kraft Heinz intern you’ll be the owner of your own projects and especially of your own career. At Kraft Heinz, we provide the playing field. You change the game. Are you up for the challenge?  

About Us 

The Kraft Heinz Company is one of the largest food and beverage companies in the world, with eight $1 billion+ brands and global sales of approximately $25 billion. We’re a globally trusted producer of high-quality, great-tasting, and nutritious foods for over 150 years. Our brands are truly global, with products produced and marketed in over 40 countries. These beloved products include condiments and sauces, cheese and dairy, meals, meats, refreshment beverages, coffee, infant and nutrition products, and numerous other grocery products in a portfolio of more than 200 legacy and emerging brands.

We spark joy around mealtime with our iconic brands, including Heinz, Kraft, Bull's-Eye, HP, Lea and Perrins, Quero, ABC, Master, Banquete, Plasmon, Orlando, Benedicta, Honig, Pudliszki, Wattie’s among others.

No matter the brand, we’re united under one vision  To sustainably grow by delighting more consumers globally. Bringing this vision to life is our team of 39,000+ food lovers, creative thinkers, and high performers worldwide. Together, we help provide meals to those in need through our global partnership with Rise Against Hunger. We also stand committed to responsible, sustainable practices that extend to every facet of our business, our consumers, and our communities. Every day, we’re transforming the food industry with bold thinking and unprecedented results. If you share our passion – and are ready to create the future, build a legacy, and lead as a global citizen – there’s only one thing to do join our table and let’s make life delicious!

Our Culture of Ownership, Meritocracy & Collaboration 

We're not afraid to think differently. Embrace new ideas. Dream big. We empower our people at every level – from entry-level intern to senior leader – to own their work. We share a responsibility to think like Owners – to be mindful of the collective and sustained success of Kraft Heinz – which we apply to every situation, every day. As part of Kraft Heinz, you're supported to grow and achieve. You’re expected to bring your authentic self to work every day, to lead with humility, and drive outstanding performance at every level – and you’ll be rewarded. You’re given opportunities to leave a mark and build a legacy. But you won’t do it alone.  You’re supported by passionate teammates along the way, and our collective, collaborative spirit fuels our incredible progress.

About Us

Kraft Heinz is a global food company with a delicious heritage. With iconic and emerging food and beverage brands around the world, we deliver the best taste, fun and quality to every meal table we touch. We’re on a mission to disrupt not only our own business, but the global food industry. A consumer obsession and unexpected partnerships fuel our progress as we drive innovation across every part of our company.

Around the world, our people are connected by a culture of ownership, agility and endless curiosity. We also believe in being good humans, who are working to improve our company, communities, and planet. We’re proud of where we’ve been – and even more thrilled about where we’re headed – as we nourish the world and lead the future of food.

Why Us

We grow our people to grow our business. We champion great people who bring ambition, curiosity, and high performance to the table as the guardians of our beloved and nostalgic brands. Good isn't good enough. We choose greatness every day by challenging the ordinary and making bold decisions. All while celebrating our wins - and our failures – as we work together to lead the future of food.

Challenging the status quo takes talent. We invest in your purpose and potential by developing skills and nurturing strengths that leave a legacy on our business and a lasting impact on your career. Because great people make great companies, and we’re growing something great here at Kraft Heinz.
title: Data Analyst Intern

companyDescription:
VvAA: de stem en steun van zorgverleners

Het collectief VvAA bestaat uit ruim 130.000 leden. Gezamenlijk maken we ons sterk voor zaken als vermindering van bureaucratie in de zorg en bezieling van de zorgverlener.  Daarnaast ondersteunt VvAA individuele leden en hun zorgondernemingen met relevante kennis, advies, verzekeringen en andere beroepsspecifieke dienstverlening. Ontwikkeld door en voor zorgverleners.
companySlogan: De stem en steun van zorgverleners.
descriptionText:
Waarom VvAA ?

 Ruimte voor jouw talenten en groeiwensen  Een baan met impact op de zorg  Vrijheid om te doen waar je goed in bent 

Databasemarketeer | Data Analist

Dit wordt je baan

jij weet als geen ander wat het werk van een databasemarketeer/data analist inhoudt. Zo analyseer jij data, biedt jij inzicht in deze data en geef je advies. Wat het werk bij VvAA extra bijzonder maakt, is uiteraard de doelgroep waarvoor wij werken: zorgprofessionals en zorgorganisaties in Nederland, maar ook het agile werken maakt je werk extra uitdagend. Hoewel je thuisbasis de data-afdeling is, werk je samen in een (vast) expert data teams. Jouw team is het team Klantcommunicatie. Dit team bestaat uit een product owner, marketeer, communicatiespecialist en een webredacteur en is verantwoordelijk voor de communicatie naar onze klanten, bijvoorbeeld in de vorm van een mailing. Ieder teamlid heeft zijn eigen expertise, maar door samen te werken en jullie kennis met elkaar te delen stijgt de kwaliteit van opleveringen en de efficiency van het team. Zo ben jij de expert op het gebied van data. Gaat er een mailing uit, dan ben jij verantwoordelijk voor de selectie en het verzendbestand klaarzetten. Vervolgens meet jij het (communicatie)proces: hoe vaak wordt de mail geopend, wordt er op de link geklikt, etc. Aan de hand van de verkregen data geef jij advies en deel jij ook meteen jouw ideeën. Als team werk je aan één doel in sprints van twee weken.

Dit is wat je nodig hebt

Wij willen innoveren op het gebied van data en daarbij is het belangrijk dat jij jouw kennis en ervaring met enthousiasme weet over te brengen op je VvAA-collega’s. Je bent sparringpartner, denkt vooruit, geeft inzicht en durft dit ook te delen en te presenteren. Jij creëert kansen. Uiteraard is het belangrijk dat jij over de juiste vaardigheden en competenties beschikt:

Je hebt hbo-werk- en denkniveauJe hebt 1 tot 3 jaar werkervaring in een soortgelijke functieJe bent SQL-gecertificeerd (is een must) en beheerst PowerBIPyton en Salesforce (Marketing Cloud) is een preJe werkt planmatig, denkt vanuit dataperspectief en werkt proactiefJe hebt goede communicatieve, presentatie- en adviesvaardigheden

Dit is waar je op kan rekenen

Een baan als data analist waarin je de vrijheid krijgt om te doen waar je goed in bent, en hier nog beter in te worden. Zo krijg jij bij ons de ruimte om jezelf verder te ontwikkelen. Hier sta je aan het roer van je eigen groeiplan. Wij vinden het belangrijk dat jij met plezier werkt en sterk in je functie staat. Hoe wij dit doen? Door goed voor jou te zorgen. Zo kun je hier rekenen op:

Een salaris tussen de € 3200 en €3750 op basis van 38 uurEen 13e maand, vakantiegeld, reiskostenvergoeding en pensioensregelingJaarlijks budget voor persoonlijke groei en om jezelf professioneel verder te ontwikkelen in het datavak25 vakantiedagen en de mogelijkheid om bij te kopenKorting op verzekeringenEen goede werksfeer met collega’s die je motiveren en stimuleren, want doe jij je werk uitzonderlijk goed? Dan kun je door je collega's genomineerd worden voor de on-the-spot beloning; een cadeau of financiële beloning als erkenning voor je uitzonderlijke inzet of het bijzondere resultaat.

Dit is VvAA en jouw team

Bij VvAA staan we als één team achter de zorg. Samen helpen we ruim 130.000 zorgprofessionals, en organisaties waarin zij werken, met alles waarvoor zij niet zijn opgeleid. Ons kantoor is toegankelijk voor iedereen. Ieder mens is uniek en wij hebben oog voor jou. Juist het verschil tussen onze achtergronden en expertises, versterkt onze slagkracht. Samen weten we meer en kunnen we meer. Samen zijn we één VvAA en staan wij als één team achter de zorg.

Als databasemarketeer/data analist werk je op de afdeling Leden Informatie en Analyse (LIA). Hoewel iedere collega in een ander multidisciplinair team werkt, verbindt het datavak ons nauw tot elkaar. Zo sparren we graag met elkaar en helpen we elkaar waar nodig.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wensen wij niet.

Lees volledige vacature
title: Databasemarketeer | Data Analist

companyDescription:
Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritional and branded generic medicines. Our 114,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.
 
Connect with us at www.abbott.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Abbott and www.facebook.com/AbbottCareers, on Instagram @AbbottGlobal, and on Twitter @AbbottNews.

We invite you to explore opportunities at Abbott, to see if your talents and career aspirations may fit with our openings. An equal opportunity employer, Abbott welcomes and encourages diversity in our workforce.
descriptionText:
Abbott is a global healthcare leader, creating breakthrough science to improve people’s health. We’re always looking towards the future, anticipating changes in medical science and technology.

We currently looking for a Principal Statistician to join our Global Biometrics and Data Center Department.

Primary Job Function

Coordinates, provides and delivers methodological and statistical expertise and/or statistical analyses for clinical studies in EPD. In this matter supports both the Clinical Development portfolio as well as Strategic Medical Affairs in their support to Affiliates, thereby complying with international, regulatory guidelines and EPD policies and standards. Directs the operational aspects of statistical work as outsourced to CROs.

Core Job Responsibilities

Will drive statistical topics as assigned by Head Biometrics to further the knowledge and impact of applied statistics to clinical development and marketed products support. Will function as lead statistician for several areas, including vaccins and biosimilars, from development plan to study designs, submissions and data exploration.Provides adequate and qualified statistical and methodological support to EPD, eg input into Clinical Development Plans, and study protocols. Responsible for appropriate statistical methodology and endpoint definitions as part of the design of clinical studies and for the associated sample size considerations, including calculations and references. Writes and/or reviews the statistical part of the protocol.Responsible for briefing the CRO to an appropriate conduct of statistical analysis of EPD Clinical Development studies. This entails review of the statistical analysis plan, participation in Blind Data Reviews, review of study report tables, listings and figures. Incumbent approves the lock of the database and requests unblinding of the study for subsequent analysis. Together with the Clinician, clarifies and communicates the results and conclusions in order to ensure the correct interpretation of the results by different users.Supports dossier submissions and answers statistical questions related to the file.For purpose of integrated analyses of internal compound data bases that are accumulating, incumbent writes the strategic and more detailed integration plans in co-operation with Clinical and ensures proper execution.Fully exploits the potential of the data in order to enhance the knowledge of the compound through data integration and data utilization activities (meta-analyses, data explorations).Reviews statistical literature and attends conferences and courses in order to ensure a high statistical expertise and maintain proficiency: Works with other statisticians to acquire knowledge on new/improved statistical methodology. Keeps up to date in relevant statistical expertise and clinical content expertise.

Position Accountability/Scope

Accountable for statistical design (including sample size justification), analysis and reporting of EPD clinical studiesAccountable for statistical review of Affiliate study protocolsAccountable for providing statistical support for development and/or product strategies

Minimum Education/Experience

MSc. / PhD in Statistics, or Biostatistics, or a related field.Demonstrated high competence in experimental design and statistical inference. Thorough understanding of International Conference on Harmonization (ICH) Guideline and relevant regulatory requirements (e.g., EU, US, or China). Minimum 7 years experience as Statistician in pharmaceutical industry or CRO.Able to "explain" statistics to non-statisticians but also to defend statistical cases (e.g., study design features). The incumbent is a team worker, driving for quality, and pro-active, but also insistent on statistical issues.Works collaboratively with function management and multiple stakeholders to develop strategies for addressing issues/requirements that arise in clinical development and marketed products support.

Working at Abbott 

At Abbott, You Can Do Work That Matters, Grow And Learn, Care For Yourself And Your Family, Be Your True Self And Live a Full Life. You Will Have Access To

Working at the #1 Top Employer in the Netherlands (for three consecutive years);Career development with an international company where you can grow the career you dream of;A company recognized as a great place to work in dozens of countries around the world and named one of the most admired companies in the world by Fortune;A company that is recognized as one of the best big companies to work for as well as the best place to work for diversity, working mothers, female executives and scientists;Excellent employment conditions that you can arrange yourself;A budget that you can use to follow non-work-related training and courses that contribute to your personal development;A sports allowance for work on your fitness;Personal financial planning advice to map out your current financial situation.

How to apply?

If you are appealed by Abbott, looking for a job with meaning, and recognize yourself in the outlined profile, please make your interest known. You can apply via our website (https://www.jobs.abbott/) with your resume and letter of application. Please let me know if you have any questions or comments referring this job profile to Niels Dijkstra, recruitment.netherlands@abbott.com
title: Principal Statistician

companyDescription:
Just Eat Take​away​.com is a lead­ing glob­al online food deliv­ery mar­ket­place, con­nect­ing con­sumers and restau­rants through our plat­form in 20 coun­tries. Like a dinner table, working at JET brings our office employees and couriers together.

From coding to customer service to couriers, JET is a fun, fast-paced and supportive place where you can be yourself.

No day is the same. Our days are filled with new experiences. We see every challenge that comes our way as a chance to grow, both the business, and ourselves.

We’re connected to millions of food-lovers, hundreds of thousands of connected partners and some of the best-known brands of the planet. When you take your seat here, you’ll find that a simple scribble on a napkin can turn into something seen by millions. 

Together we transform, create, reinvent and empower every food moment. 

As a leading online food tech company, JET brings together the stability of a global business, with the agility of a start-up. We got here by always staying one step ahead of the competition.

So load up your plate with ideas that get you excited, because at JET everything is on the table.

https://careers.justeattakeaway.com
descriptionText:
Ready for a Challenge

Then Just Eat Takeaway.com might be the place for you. We’re a leading global online food delivery platform, and our vision is to empower everyday convenience. Whether it’s a Friday-night feast, a post-gym poke bowl, or grabbing some groceries, our tech platform connects tens of millions of customers with hundreds of thousands of restaurant, grocery and convenience partners across the globe.

All About The Role

Performance measurement is a unique intersection of marketing and analytics, where young professionals can experience how data analytics solutions are being applied to real-life business problems. The intern will also have the opportunity to gain hands-on experience in JET's sophisticated data infrastructure.

Along with the Key Responsibilities listed, you will understand the key drivers behind marketing KPIs. You will contribute to mid-size projects and work effectively within a high-performing team, able to provide valuable development to newer members.

Various ad hoc projects will also come your way, including assisting the wider marketing analytics team with campaign performance analysis, Tableau dashboard development, and other strategic projects.

These are some of the key ingredients to the role:

You will create data visualisations to improve business processes by creating/maintaining Tableau dashboardsTogether with a senior analyst, create deep-dive analysis that exceeds regular dashboarding insights, e.g. business case development, problem-solving data analysis, etc.Investigate and troubleshoot anomalies in marketing data, data products and data pipelines. Learn and execute smooth workflow between sql, python/R, MS office suite and tableauContribute to specific marketing analysis, such as simple regression and trend analysis to identify business opportunities and abnormalities

What will you bring to the table?

Someone who loves to own the problem end to end and deliver with excellenceSome hands on experience with Tableau, Excel, and PowerPoint presentationsWorking knowledge of Bigquery SQL, R and/or PythonGood communicator, with the ability to develop strong business relationships and networks with stakeholders across a multi-national organizationEye for detail, accurate and preciseAbility to think analytically and be mathematically skilledMust be registered as a student, studying a relevant course

Here is our offer

Competitive compensation of €650 per monthThe opportunity to develop your skills and experience in a hands-on internshipYou'll be in a dynamic, friendly workplace in the heart of Amsterdam Office with fantastic amenities; Delicious tea & coffee, fresh fruit, ping pong and our famous Friday drinks…to name a few! Great team and company event.

At JET, This Is On The Menu

Our teams forge connections internally and work with some of the best-known brands on the planet, giving us truly international impact in a dynamic environment.

Fun, fast-paced and supportive, the JET culture is about movement, growth and about celebrating every aspect of our JETers. Thanks to them we stay one step ahead of the competition.

Inclusion, Diversity & Belonging

No matter who you are, what you look like, who you love, or where you are from, you can find your place at Just Eat Takeaway.com. We’re committed to creating an inclusive culture, encouraging diversity of people and thinking, in which all employees feel they truly belong and can bring their most colorful selves to work every day.

What else is cooking?

Want to know more about our JETers, culture or company? Have a look at our career site where you can find people's stories, blogs, podcasts and more JET morsels.

Are you ready to take your seat? Apply now!
title: Performance Data Analyst Intern

companyDescription:
BridgeFund is een platform voor ondernemers, dat vraag en aanbod van geld op een slimme manier bij elkaar brengt. Zonder tussenkomst van een bank.

Aan de ene kant stellen ondernemers geld beschikbaar aan het platform in ruil voor rendement en aan de andere kant kunnen ondernemers dit geld lenen om te investeren. 

Op deze manier willen wij samen met ondernemers maatschappelijke impact maken. Door de nodeloos trage en complexe financiële wereld aan zijn enkels de 21e eeuw in te trekken. Wij zorgen dat geld kan doen waar het voor gemaakt is: de wereld in beweging brengen. Want geld dat aan het werk kan, daar worden ondernemers blij van. En geld ook.

Make money smile
companySlogan: Het financieringsplatform voor ondernemers dat vraag en aanbod van geld bij elkaar brengt.
descriptionText:
Je bent gek op data. Toch? Bij BridgeFund krijg je de kans om jouw passie voor data en innovatieve strategieën en campagnes in te zetten! Sta aan het roer van onze groei en laat jouw stempel achter in de wereld van fintech. Klaar om jouw marketingvaardigheden naar nieuwe hoogten te tillen?
Wat ga je doen?Als Data Analist bij BridgeFund ben je cruciaal in het interpreteren van marketingdata en het omzetten van inzichten in gerichte strategieën. Je analyseert klantdata en markttrends om de effectiviteit van campagnes te meten en te verbeteren. Door klantsegmentatie en -profilering creëer je gedetailleerde profielen voor gerichte marketingstrategieën. Je optimaliseert marketingprocessen door procesautomatisering te adviseren en te implementeren Je werkt in het datateam samen met Data Engineers en Data Scientists die zorgdragen voor het data fundament en de andere teams ondersteunen bij hun data vraagstukken. Jouw - en je collega’s - werk zorgt ervoor dat we nog meer data-gedreven opereren als organisatie.Wat je gaat doen:Jouw analyses van marketingdata en voorstellen voor optimalisaties en automatiseringen zorgt voor verbeterde campagneconversies.Je identificeert en definieert verschillende klantsegmenten op basis van gedrag, demografie en andere relevante factoren om zo beter inzicht te krijgen in klantgedrag.je bouwt mee aan het creëren van een cultuur binnen het marketingteam waarin datagestuurde besluitvorming centraal staat.Identificeren en definiëren van klantsegmenten voor gerichte marketingbenaderingen.Creëren van overzichtelijke rapporten en visualisaties voor communicatie van bevindingen.Samenwerken met cross-functionele teams om datagestuurde inzichten te integreren in bedrijfsstrategieën.Je helpt het marketingteam bij het uitvoeren van A/B testen.
Wat biedt BridgeFund jou?Een leuke, uitdagende functie bij een ambitieuze FinTech scale-up in een snel groeiende omgeving. Daardoor is geen dag hetzelfde. Je krijgt bij ons veel vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheid. Daardoor ontwikkel jij je snel en kun je echt impact maken in de organisatie.
Je ontvangt 26 vakantiedagen; voldoende tijd dus om af en toe op te laden.Je pensioen is goed geregeld bij ASR, +4% op je bruto salaris.Je krijgt €0,21 per kilometer reiskostenvergoeding, ook als je met de fiets komt.Uber(Eats), ClassPass of Felyx tegoed? Stel zelf je secundaire arbeidswaarden samen met €40 YourCampus tegoed per maand.Jouw ontwikkeling vinden we super belangrijk. Daarom hebben we zowel opleidingen die afgestemd op mensen individueel als trainingen voor het hele team.Super funky kantoor in Amsterdam, vlakbij het Amstel station. Bij ons geen hokjes of systeemplafonds.Partyen en varen op de BridgeFund boot. Vrienden mee? Gezellig!We geven elk kwartaal de tofste feesten en borrels. Successen vieren we samen.Op wintersport of feesten in Berlijn. Onze volledig betaalde trips naar het buitenland wil je niet missen.Elke dag verzorgde lunch. Op vrijdag geef je bij ons je bestelling door voor broodjes, soep en salade. Op maandag hebben we Meatless Monday.Een goede vaste werkplek. Je krijgt van ons een MacBook en twee schermen. Ook hebben we stabureaus, mocht je dat af en toe fijn vinden.Een plek waar jij je thuis voelt en iedereen zichzelf kan zijn.
Onze cultuurWat BridgeFund uniek maakt is onze cultuur. Dit is ook een van de belangrijkste redenen waarom we zo hard groeien. We delen dezelfde mindset. We zijn een hecht team van gedreven, ambitieuze mensen die de financiële wereld op zijn kop willen zetten. We zijn echte ondernemers. En dat merk je bij ons op de werkvloer. Hard werken, maar ook groots onze successen samen vieren. Hiërarchie vinden we maar een moeilijk woord en top-down doen we alleen als we met elkaar gaan skiën. We stellen kritische vragen, geven eerlijk feedback en zijn niet bang om af en toe te falen, want falen betekent leren en leren is groeien.
Wat kunnen wij van jou leren?Als Data Analist bij BridgeFund breng je een schat aan ervaring en expertise mee op het gebied van data-analyse. We zijn op zoek naar iemand die vaardig is met tools zoals SQL, Python, en data-visualisatieplatforms zoals Qlik, Tableau, of Power BI. Communicatieve vaardigheden zijn essentieel om complexe analyses om te zetten in begrijpelijke inzichten voor niet-technische collega's en om effectief samen te werken binnen teams.`
Wat wij van jou verwachten:Minimaal 3-5 jaar ervaring in een vergelijkbare rol binnen data-analyse, bij voorkeur binnen een marketingcontext.Ervaring met data tools zoals SQL, Python, en bij voorkeur Databricks.Kennis van statistische methoden voor analyse van marketinggegevens.Begrip van marketingfundamenten voor het koppelen van analyses en verbeteringen.Vermogen om complexe analyses op een begrijpelijke manier te communiceren.Je bent een teamplayer, maar tegelijkertijd zelfstandig en zelfredzaam.Perfect Nederland & Engels.
Over BridgeFund: een FinTech scale-up op een missieBridgeFund, opgericht in 2018 in Amsterdam, is een club eigenwijze en soms een beetje ongeduldige doorzetters die maatschappelijke impact willen maken. Een groep van 90 ambitieuze, positieve rebellen. Een groep die hard werkt, maar zichzelf niet te serieus neemt. Een team van gelijkgestemden, committed aan dezelfde missie: laten zien dat een bankvrije wereld makkelijker, efficiënter, eerlijker en dus leuker is. Wat wij doen? Een digitale brug slaan tussen stilstaand vermogen van succesvolle ondernemers en werkkapitaal voor ambitieuze ondernemers. Door middel van slimme technologie wordt de financiële data van een onderneming razendsnel en zorgvuldig geanalyseerd om te bepalen hoeveel een ondernemer maximaal verantwoord kan lenen. Aan de andere kant hebben wij beleggers die dit allemaal mogelijk maken! En samen brengen we zo Nederland in beweging.
Dear agencies: if we need external recruiters to help us fill vacancies, it will be through HirePort. Through this form, you can register yourself there as an external recruiter: https://hireport.nl/bridgefund/. That also means you don’t have to call me or a hiring manager! :)
